body:
When WooCommerce calculates the tax it first multiples the price without tax by the quantity being ordered. So as far as WooCommerce s concerned, the price to apply tax to is £72.51. It adds 20% to this value. You then get £87.012. It is this final number which is rounded down to £87.01.

To show that mathematically:

24.17 x 3 x (1 + 0.2) = 87.012.

If you want WC to change the way it calculates that tax you'll have to add the code to your functions.php file. It might look a little like the following:

add_filter( 'woocommerce_get_price_excluding_tax', 'custom_edit_price_function',10,3);

function custom_edit_price_function($price, $qty, $product) {
    //calculate price how you like it here.
    return $price;
}
title: Woocommerce tax rounding issue
